intro: Zehneria grayana var. vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Zehneria, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
